markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fighting Stick](/Weapons.aspx?ID=168)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Backswing" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=173" />
<trait label="Halfling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=87" />
<trait label="Nonlethal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=188" />
<trait label="Shove" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=193" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [The Mwangi Expanse](/Sources.aspx?ID=89) pg. 86 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Access** Song'o ethnicity

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 5 sp

**Damage** 1d6 B

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Club](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=5)
</row>

</column>

---

This hard but flexible longsword-length piece of wood looks more like a pole than a weapon, but can be deadly in the right hands. While generally not used for combat outside of Song’o culture, some halflings have become so proficient as to make it just as effective as a blade in a fight. Many halflings will even sing to maintain a certain tempo and rhythm during combat. It deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage. A fighting stick is a martial one-handed melee weapon in the club weapon group

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-5" />
name: Fighting Stick
